'''''Golden Leaves''''' is a song composed by [[Bear McCreary]] for the [[Elven Kings Under the Sky|first episode]] of the second season of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]''. It features lyrics sung in [[Quenya]] by [[Benjamin Walker]], who plays [[Gil-galad]] on the show. Accordings to Bear McCreary, the lyrics were crafted by [[John D. Payne]], inspired in part by the lyrics [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] wrote for [[Galadriel's Song]] in ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]''<ref>[https://bearmccreary.com/the-lord-of-the-rings-episode-201/ The Lord of the Rings: Episode 201], by [[Bear McCreary]], oct. 1, 2024.</ref>.

==Poem==
<poem>
''Sís laurië lassi taiter,''
''yénin linwavandië.''
''Anpalla Vai Ahtalëa,''
''sí lantar Eldaniër.''

''[[Eldalië|Eldalié]]! Eldalié!''
''Hrívë túla helda ré úlassëa.''
''Eldalié! Eldalié!''
''I lassi lantar celumenna.''

(children’s choir:) ''Cormar nelde aranin Eldaron''

''Eldalié and’ amárielvë''
''ambena solor.''
''Sí néca riëmancan,''
''viliën an Valinor''

''Eldalié! Eldalié!''
''Hrívë túla helda ré úlassëa.''
''Eldalié! Eldalié!''
''I lassi lantar celumenna.''
</poem>

==Translation==
The Quenya text above along with its following translation were published by Amazon's composer Bear McCreary on his personal website<ref>[https://bearmccreary.com/the-lord-of-the-rings-episode-201/ The Lord of the Rings: Episode 201], by [[Bear McCreary]], oct. 1, 2024.</ref>.
<poem>
''Here long the golden leaves grew,''
''on years branching.''
''For beyond the Sundering Seas,''
''now fall Elven-tears.''

''O’ Elven-kind! O’ Elven-kind!''
''Winter is coming, bare leafless day.''
''O’ Elven-kind! O’ Elven-kind!''
''The leaves are falling in the stream.''
 
(children's choir:) ''Three rings for the Elven kings''
 
''Elven-kind long have we dwelt''
''upon this hither shore.''
''Now fading crown I trade,''
''to sail to Valinor.''

''O’ Elven-kind! O’ Elven-kind!''
''Winter is coming, bare leafless day.''
''O’ Elven-kind! O’ Elven-kind!''
''The leaves are falling in the stream.''
</poem>

The series scene actually features only the two last stanzas, however the full song does play during the credits.
